meanings.definition: A large amount or number of something.
meanings.sent1: She had kaboodles of toys in her room.
meanings.sent2: There were kaboodles of people at the concert.
meanings.sent3: The store had kaboodles of colorful balloons for sale.
meanings.sent4: The garden was filled with kaboodles of blooming flowers.
meanings.sent5: The treasure chest was overflowing with kaboodles of gold coins.

meanings.definition: To gather or collect in a large quantity.
meanings.sent1: He managed to kaboodles all the fallen leaves in the yard.
meanings.sent2: The kids decided to kaboodles seashells at the beach.
meanings.sent3: She tried to kaboodles all the scattered puzzle pieces quickly.
meanings.sent4: The ants began to kaboodles food crumbs from the picnic.
meanings.sent5: The workers had to kaboodles the scattered papers before the meeting.
